intro: Pachypleuria microsora, commonly known as the small-leaf pachypleura, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and small, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
